summary: This is my own Xbox360 gamepad configuration that enhances the default control scheme of Skyrim with five new hotkeys and increased functionality. Like ability to quicksave or quickload. If you like what you see, grab it for youself!
descriptionHtml:
This is my own Xbox360 gamepad configuration, and it was made to suit my own play style.
I don\'t like too complicated settings, but I like more functionality when I play Skyrim.
I\'ve didn\'t make any changes to default control scheme, just added more hotkeys.

I know there\'re many other configurations out there, still I\'ve decided to share my config, maybe someone will prefer this one over the others. So, If you like what you see, grab it for youself!

=============================================
HOTKEYS ONLY version includes:
Hotkey 1: DPad left (default)
Hotkey 2: DPad right (default)
Hotkey 3: LB+DPad left
Hotkey 4: LB+DPad right
Hotkey 5: LB+X
Hotkey 6: LB+Y
Hotkey 7: LB+RB
Quicksave: LB+Start
Quickload: LB+Back

MORE FUNCTIONALITY version includes:
Hotkey 1: DPad left (default)
Hotkey 2: DPad right (default)
Hotkey 3: LB+DPad left
Hotkey 4: LB+DPad right
Hotkey 5: LB+X
Hotkey 6: LB+Y
Hotkey 7: LB+RB
Quicksave: LB+Start
Quickload: LB+Back
Quick Magic Menu:      A+DPad left
Quick Inventory Menu:  A+DPad right
Quick Map Menu:        A+DPad up
Screenshot:            A+Back or A+Start

=============================================
Information:
*In Skyrim, you may notice that there\'s a small delay between pressing LB and making your character sprint. You can easly use that delay by quick button presses, so you can manage your inventory by hotkeys, and not make your character sprint.

*When you hold down LB, it will make your character sprint as intended. You of course can change weapons and spells, drink potions or change equipment that are hotkeyed while sprinting.

*While using more functionality version, watch out for picking up objects accidentally.
*Settings where made for default user interface and default control scheme.

=============================================
Instalation and deinstalation:
Just extract this file into you Skyrim instalation directory (Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim)

If you use other configurations, you may want to make a backup of them, follow \\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Data\\Interface\\Controls\\PC\\and backup file named cotrolmap.txt

If you want to remove this configuration, follow \\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Data\\Interface\\Controls\\PC\\and remove file named cotrolmap.txt

=============================================
That is all! I hope you like it!
-defosh369
author: defosh369
